page.title: 06TEMPLE DINSLEY, PRESTON
page.content: The manor of Temple Dinsley was part of the royal estates in the Domesday Book.William Rufus then gave it to Bernard de Balliol and later the manor was given to the Knights Templar.The knights exercised considerable power locally until the dissolution of the order in 1309.In 1348 the manor was bestowed on the Knights Hospitallers of St.John of Jerusalem until the dis_ solution of the monasteries by Henry V111.After that it became the resi_ dence of a succession of families.In 1714 Benedict Ithell,a City merchant, bought the estate,demolished the house and built the central part of the present building.In 1909 a new west front and domestic wing were added,de_ signed by Sir Edwin Lutyens.It re_ mained a family house until 1935 when it became Princess Helena College.
